title: Labor Day Weekend"
column6: "The Revolutionary war is widely considered to have ended at Yorktown. However
column7: on the frontier borders of this fledgling country
column8: the war was still very much alive
column9: and the small community of Wheeling was struggling to survive continuing conflict with the British and their Native-American allies. For the colonial denizens of Wheeling
column10: hardship was a way of life
column11: and the threat of sudden death was a constant companion. The area’s lone stronghold
column13: was the only means of defense for this frontier settlement
column14: and the people of the area depended on it for their very lives. Fort Henry Days is a tribute to Wheeling’s frontier era. Witness history come to life through dramatic battle re-enactments and period correct demonstrations. Return to the time of Betty Zane
column16: and Lewis Wetzel. Return to a time where uncommon courage was commonplace."

title: "Prickett's Fort Opens"
description: Prickett's Fort invites visitors to relive the pioneering spirit of Captain Jacob Prickett and his family

column6: The Whiskey Rebellion Festival celebrates the heritage and unique character of the region by focusing on the historical significance of the Whiskey Rebellion, a history that is exclusive to western Pennsylvania and primarily Washington County. The festival honors the significant period of America’s early days through historic reenactments, period exhibitions and demonstrations, family fun, frontier art, heritage music and food, all the while shining a national spotlight on the city, county and region. Community focused entertainment combines with nationally renowned artists to create a festival that acknowledges the past, celebrates the present and looks toward the future.

The Great Trail Festival is a special celebration of American Folk Art, with Contemporary and Country Crafting. A unique experience which invites your discovery and pleasure. Visit the Storybook Craft Village where handcrafted gifts and treasured keepsakes await you. Selected quality artisans with distinctive arts & crafts are the heart of it all at Great Trail. The festival is held annually at the Great Trail Festival Grounds and features exhibitors from Ohio and surrounding states.

"The Washington and Greene Counties Tourism Promotion Agencies invite you to take part in a celebration of their rich histories and beautiful countrysides during the annual EQT Washington and Greene Counties' Covered Bridge Festival. Each of the 10 festival locations offer a charming atmosphere and an array of activities including handmade arts and crafts
column9: crafting demonstrations and delightful entertainment. Held the third weekend in September each year
column10: the Covered Bridge Festival is regarded as a signature event in the area and the official start to the fall season."
